The aroma of freshly baked bread wafted through the air as Maria stepped into the cozy bakery on the corner. She smiled as she admred the rows of golden-brown loaves, each one perfectly shaped and inviting. Behind the counter, the baker greeted her warmly, his hands dusted with flour as he skillfully kneaded dough for the next batch. Maria couldn't resist ordering a loaf of sourdough bread, her favorite and a few pastries to enjoy with her afternoon tea. As she left the bakery, a sense of warmth and comfort enveloped her, a feeling that only freshly baked goods could evoke.
What does Maria do when she enters the bakery?
b: She lookes at the rows of bread
d: She orders a cup of coffee

The passengers all knew me, and they merendace used to talk to me every time I left my cabin. I didn't have any privacy. Of course. I had to  them chat  politely even when I wasn't in the mood

pregunta: A mummy discovered in 1903 as that of Queen Hatshepsut, the mummy was originally found in the Valley the Kings, Although the mummy was discovered more than a century ago,  it remained in a tomb until this last spring, when it was brought to the Cairo Museum for testing.

c: The mummy has been in a king room since It was discovered
d: The mummy has been in a museum since it was discovered

Valentine's Day (or Saint Valentine's Day) is a holiday  that, in the United States, takes place on February 14,and technically signifies the accomplishments of St Valentine, a third - century Roman saint:
With that said, most Americans, instead of honoring St. Valentine through religious ceremony, enjoy the holiday by engaging in "romantic" behavior with their significant other or someone who they wish to be their significant other; gifts, special dinners, and other acknowledgements of affection comprise most individuals' Valentine's  Day celebrations.
What does Valentine's Day technically signify?
